courseDetails.title: Helm for absolute beginners
courseDetails.shortDescription: Learn how to manage applications with Helm, the package manager  for Kubernetes
courseDetails.longDescription:
Kubernetes offers a rich set of features that facilitate application deployment, scaling, and operations.

An applications in Kubernetes may have different objects such as deployments, services, persistant volume claims, persistant volumes, secrets, ConfigMaps and more.

Each object needs its own YAML file for its configuration. we can put the configuration for all the Kubernetes objects in a single YAML file, but this is not ideal and not recommended.

Although these objects are part of a single application, Kubernetes doesn't consider them as a group of objects parts of the same application, and manages each object independently from the others.

For example when deploying this application into a Kubernetes cluster, we create the objects one after the other, by executing the kubectl create command followed by the name of the manifest file for each object

The same when updating or  deleting the application, the Kubernetes objects parts of this application are treated separately, and this makes the process of deploying and maintaining applications in Kubernetes a boring and tedious task.

Helm solves these problems and reduces this complexity, through the concept of Helm charts.

In this course, we will learn how does Helm make the process of deploying applications in Kubernetes much easier. We will practice also working with Helm and the Helm CLI to manage applications in Kubernetes.


Requirements for this Course:

  • Basic knowledge of Kubernetes

Who this course is for:

  • Developers

  • DevOps engineers

  • Anyone interested to learn how to manage applications in Kubernetes using the Helm package manager.

What you’ll learn

  • What is Helm?

  • Why do we need Helm?

  • What are Helm charts, Helm revisions and Helm releases?

  • Searching for Helm charts in the Artifuct Hub

  • Searching for Helm charts in the repositories added to our local Helm client

  • Installing Helm charts

  • Customizing Helm chart installation
targetAudiences: Developers
DevOps engineers
Anyone interested to learn how to manage applications in Kubernetes using the Helm package manager

courseDetails.title: Leadership - Leading a Community

courseDetails.longDescription:
We have seen many forms of leadership in the past decade.


One of the leadership failings that seem to have developed in recent times, or become more prevalent is Community leadership with the advent of online community groups.

The concept of communities isn't new or revolutionary, but the impact on community members can be life changing in so many ways possible.

More than ever before, I believe we need community groups and interactions with one another.

Not just from a moral stand point, but for businesses.

Who is this course for?

Leadership who are trying to do some of the following:

- Businesses trying to foster deeper engagement with staff, customers and connected to them

- Health related communities

- Finance communities (debt, savings, investments etc)

- Business

- Skills

- Arts and craft

- Charities or Non Governmental Organisations

- Social groups

- School groups

- Neighbourhood groups

- Political groups

- Religious communities

- Cultural communities

- Age groups

- Causes

- Trade and other Associations

- A whole segment around Vision, Purpose, Ideas and Communication as a Leader: exploring Vision, Understanding Your Role as Vision Architect, Building images of the Future, Communicating these, Managing Stakeholders, Illustrative Examples, Immediate Steps you can take today as a Leader and more.

- Building trust as a Leader segment, helps highlight actions you can take to earn the trust of everyone you are responsible for and even yourself.

- Disagreements, Disputes and Conflict management

- Taking care of Yourself as someone responsible for others.

and so many others areas.

No doubt that community and interaction with people will be more important in our lives than ever in the coming years.

It is a good platform to help people reach their objectives, support them, provide information for them and do so much more.

The times when Community group leaders seem to do well and their members struggle should be over. Communities, one of key pillars is collective outcomes.

This is designed to help people thinking about setting up community groups, already in the leadership of community groups and community group members.

I believe we should have as many businesses, entrepreneurs, start ups, people with skills and as many of us running or having community groups as a channel to engage with and reach people. Because, it can be fulfilling, rewarding and most of all profitable, when done right: with respect, dignity and delivering on the promises made.


This extensive, well-rounded course is designed to be a reference and resource for you to come back to at various times, addressing questions you might have relating to the very many areas covered. 


Thank you for stopping by.


Best regards,

Baba Oyewole FCCA

courseDetails.title: ISO 22000: Operational PRPs (GMP) for Food Manufacturing
courseDetails.shortDescription: Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) - Good Hygiene Practice (GHP) ) - Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points HACCP
courseDetails.longDescription:
Elevate your restaurant’s food safety standards with our expert-led course on HACCP, GMP, and Food Hygiene. Tailored specifically for Restaurant Managers, this course will equip you with the essential knowledge and tools to ensure top-notch food safety and compliance with global standards.

With a robust curriculum, this course offers an in-depth exploration of HACCP, GMP, and food hygiene which are key pillars for any restaurant manager. Whether you are new to food safety or looking to deepen your knowledge, this course will guide you through the practical steps needed to implement a foolproof food safety system in your restaurant.

This course is an essential resource for restaurant managers who want to ensure the highest standards of food safety. With comprehensive coverage of HACCP, Good Hygiene Practices (GHP), and Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), you’ll learn how to manage food safety risks and ensure compliance across your operations. By the end of the course, you’ll be equipped to implement a complete food safety management system in your restaurant and maintain food hygiene standards that protect your customers and your reputation.


This course comes with the following Sections:

  1. HACCP 101: This lecture will provide an overview of HACCP, including its definition, benefits, necessity, problems, and challenges.

  2. HACCP Principles and Regulations: In this lecture, we will discuss the seven principles of HACCP and the four main areas of the Food Safety Modernization Act.

  3. THE HACCP Plan: Learn to incorporate the HACCP Principle into the HACCP Plan of your food business.

  4. Physical, Chemical and Biological Hazards: Conduct hazard analysis and know about major food hazards to ensure food safety.

  5. Designing Food Safety: Discover how to structure a food system that ensures food safety.

  6. Implementation, Verification and Maintenance in HACCP: Learn how to tailor HACCP to fit your business from this section.

  7. HACCP Application in Supply Chain: Food safety begins before you even see the food. This section will teach HACCP application in supply chain in detail.

  8. Good Hygiene Practices (GHP) in Food Safety:  This section covers a series of lecture that outlines the importance of GHP as the foundation of food safety systems. It categorizes food hazards (chemical, biological, physical) and details GHP guidelines in the U.S. (FDA Food Code), Canada (Food and Drug Regulations, CFIA), and Europe (Regulation (EC) No 852/2004), highlighting regional differences like Europe's stronger emphasis on HACCP and stricter penalties.

  9. Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) in Food Safety:  This section outlines Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) in Food Safety, covering 5 key areas ("5 P's") and comparing GMP with GHP, SSOP, and HACCP.

  10. Operational GMP Procedures: This section outlines five pillars of Operational GMP (Quality Management, Risk Assessment, Equipment & Premises, Material Control, Production & Quality Control) to ensure product safety and quality.

  11. GMP Around the World: Codex, FSMA, and EU Compliance in Practice: This section details global GMP, FSMA, and EU 852/2004 compliance, emphasizing HACCP, food safety principles, documentation, and continuous improvement for international food production.

Enroll Now for Lifetime Access!

Gain lifetime access to this updated and comprehensive course on HACCP, food safety, hazard analysis, and GMP. Take control of your restaurant’s food safety and enhance your management skills—enroll today!

courseDetails.title: Atomic Design Mastery for Angular: From Theory to Practice
courseDetails.shortDescription: Master Atomic Design in Angular 20 with Tailwind v4 — build scalable UI, manage state, and create real-world apps
courseDetails.longDescription:
Welcome to Atomic Design Mastery for Angular: From Theory to Sustainable Practice — your complete step-by-step guide to building scalable, reusable, and beautiful applications with Angular 20 and Tailwind CSS v4.

If you’ve ever struggled with messy components, duplicated styles, or UI elements that are hard to maintain, this course is for you. We’ll take the proven Atomic Design methodology and apply it directly to Angular, giving you a clear roadmap for creating applications that grow smoothly without turning into chaos.

We start with the basics of Atomic Design, where you’ll learn how to build Atoms (buttons, inputs, icons) that are clean, testable, and accessible. Then we’ll combine those Atoms into Molecules and Organisms, forming the building blocks of your UI. From there, you’ll design Templates and Pages that define layouts and structure, making your applications consistent and professional.

Styling is powered by Tailwind v4, the latest utility-first CSS framework. You’ll learn how to use tokens, themes, and dark mode to achieve polished designs without writing endless CSS. We’ll also integrate Angular Material where needed, ensuring your components stay modern and accessible.

As you grow more confident, we’ll dive into state management with Angular Signals, building services like a shopping cart and dashboard data layers. You’ll practice real-world communication between components while keeping code clean and reactive.

In the advanced sections, we’ll unlock powerful Angular 20 features: content projection, directives, dynamic forms, dependency injection, animations, SSR (Server-Side Rendering), and even micro-frontends. Each lesson is practical and focused, showing you exactly how to apply these tools inside the Atomic Design workflow.

To make learning engaging, we’ll build real-world apps together — an E-Commerce flow, an Admin Dashboard, a Blog, a Social Feed, and a Kanban Board. These projects bring all the concepts together, giving you confidence to use them in your own work. Finally, we’ll run a Capstone Audit to check accessibility, performance, and scalability, ensuring you know how to deliver production-ready apps.

By the end of this course, you’ll not only understand Atomic Design theory, but you’ll also be able to implement it in Angular projects from start to finish. Whether you’re a beginner or an experienced developer, you’ll leave with the skills and confidence to create sustainable design systems, reusable components, and applications that teams love to work with.
targetAudiences: Beginner Angular developers who want a clear, structured way to build scalable UIs.
Intermediate Angular devs looking to level up with Atomic Design and Tailwind CSS v4.
Frontend engineers tired of messy, duplicated components and searching for reusable design patterns.
UI/UX enthusiasts who want to connect design systems with Angular code.
Team leads or full-stack devs aiming to make Angular projects sustainable and maintainable.
Students and self-learners who want hands-on practice by building real apps (E-Commerce, Blog, Kanban, Dashboard).
Anyone curious about Atomic Design and how it fits in modern Angular 20 workflows.

Overview


This comprehensive bundle unites two proven programs—CV writing/tailoring and interview mastery—into one concise, high-impact system. You’ll build an ATS-ready CV/resume that gets noticed and then convert those interviews into offers with confident, evidence-led answers. Designed for ambitious professionals at any level, the course blends recruiter insights, step-by-step templates, and realistic practice to de-risk your job search. Learn exactly how hiring managers screen applications and run interviews, then tailor your materials and delivery to what they value most.
Land the offer—not just the interview. This course gives you a complete, end-to-end system to prepare with confidence, tell a compelling professional story, and perform under pressure. Built by a Career Navigation Specialist with 15+ years of global experience (including Big Four), it combines recruiter-tested frameworks, real hiring-manager insights, and step-by-step guidance so you know exactly what to say, how to say it, and when.


What You’ll Achieve

  • Craft a sharp, modern CV/resume that passes ATS and highlights measurable impact.

  • Build a compelling 3–4 minute elevator pitch that links your strengths to the role.

  • Create a bank of STAR (Situation, Task, Action, Result) stories that quantify outcomes and stand up to probing.

  • Decode the interview flow (intro → CV review → behavioral/competency) and align your strategy to each stage.

  • Research efficiently and articulate “why this company/role” with credibility—no generic answers.

  • Ask high-signal questions and avoid low-value topics (e.g. , premature salary talk).

  • Use AI prompts, timing drills, and mock Q&A to practice until your delivery is crisp and confident.

  • Follow a 24-hour final checklist to arrive calm, prepared, and ready to close.

Why It Works


Most candidates speak in broad claims; you’ll communicate in evidence. With recruiter-tested frameworks, reflection prompts, and self-study tasks, you’ll move from guesswork to a repeatable preparation routine that showcases real business impact.
Why this course works: Most candidates speak in generalities; you’ll communicate in evidence. We start from the hiring manager’s perspective and work through each stage of the interview with practical strategies that get results. Expect clear examples, exercises, and templates you can apply immediately—no fluff, just what moves you from shortlist to signed offer.


What You’ll Learn (and Apply Right Away)

  • Build a bank of STAR stories that quantify outcomes and stand up to probing.

  • Deliver a concise 3–4 minute elevator pitch that links your strengths to the role and company.

  • Decode the interview flow (intro → CV review → behavioural/competency) and align your approach to each stage.

  • Research efficiently and articulate a credible “why this company/role”—without sounding generic.

  • Ask high-signal questions and avoid low-value topics (e.g. , premature salary talk or easily Googled facts).

  • Handle gaps, pivots, and setbacks with positive, evidence-based framing.

  • Close confidently and follow up professionally to accelerate next steps.

  • Optional: align your CV talking points to ensure the interview echoes your application and job description.

  • Ready-to-use templates, AI prompts, research checklists, and a portable Interview Toolkit

Who This Is For

  • Professionals changing roles, returning to work, or aiming for promotion; job seekers tired of being ghosted; and anyone who wants a practical, guided, real-world method for interview success.

A job-ready CV, confident interview performance, and a clear plan to turn opportunities into signed offers. Enroll now and accelerate your next career move.

courseDetails.title: كورس اساسيات الشبكات للأمن السيبراني
courseDetails.shortDescription: كورس أساسيات الشبكات لامن المعلومات هو مدخلك العملي لفهم كيفية عمل الشبكات وتامينها في عالم الأمن السيبراني.
courseDetails.longDescription:
كورس اساسيات الشبكات للامن السيبراني هو دليلك العملي والشامل لفهم كيفية عمل الشبكات الحديثة من منظور امني احترافي، حيث ياخذك خطوة بخطوة من المفاهيم الاساسية الى التطبيقات العملية التي تُستخدم فعليا في بيئات العمل والمؤسسات. يهدف هذا الكورس الى تمكين المتعلمين من بناء قاعدة معرفية قوية تؤهلهم لفهم الاتصالات الرقمية، وادارة مكونات الشبكات، وتأمينها ضد الهجمات السيبرانية المتزايدة.

خلال هذا الكورس، ستتعرف على مكونات الشبكات مثل المبدلات (Switches) والموجهات (Routers) وجدران الحماية (Firewalls)وكيفية تفاعلها لتأمين تدفق البيانات داخل الانظمة. كما ستتعلم أنواع الشبكات المختلفة مثل LAN وWAN وVLAN وWLAN، وطريقة عمل كل منها، إلى جانب فهم عميق لبروتوكولات الاتصال الاساسية مثل TCP/IP وDNS وHTTP وDHCP وFTP. سنتناول أيضا أسس تصميم الشبكات، كيفية تقسيم العناوين (Subnetting)، وأهمية التوجيه (Routing) والتحويل (Switching) في بناء بنية تحتية قوية وآمنة.

من الجانب الامني، سيركز الكورس على كيفية مراقبة حركة البيانات داخل الشبكة باستخدام أدوات تحليل الشبكات، والتعرف على الأنشطة المشبوهة ومحاولات الاختراق، وفهم آليات الهجمات الشائعة مثل DoS وMITM وPort Scanning وكيفية الوقاية منها.  كما ستتعلم كيفية إعداد سياسات التحكم في الوصول، وتأمين الشبكات اللاسلكية، والتعامل مع الثغرات الأمنية بطرق احترافية.

الكورس موجه للمبتدئين والمهتمين بدخول عالم الأمن السيبراني، وهو بمثابة الخطوة الأولى نحو التخصص في مجالات مثل اختبار الاختراق، تحليل الشبكات، إدارة الأنظمة الأمنية، ومراقبة التهديدات (SOC). سيتضمن الكورس تطبيقات واقعية وتمارين عملية تساعدك على ربط النظرية بالممارسة، مع أمثلة من سيناريوهات حقيقية تستخدم في المؤسسات والشركات الكبرى. هدف الكورس هو أن تخرج منه بفهم متكامل لبنية الشبكات وآلية تأمينها، وأن تكون قادرًا على تحليل المخاطر، وتحديد نقاط الضعف، وتنفيذ حلول حماية فعالة في بيئة العمل.

بنهاية الكورس، ستكون جاهزا للانطلاق بثقة نحو مسار احترافي في الأمن السيبراني، وتمتلك الأساس التقني الذي يفتح لك الباب أمام الشهادات العالمية مثل CompTIA Network plus وSecurity plus  وCEH، لتصبح جزءا من الجيل الجديد من محترفي أمن المعلومات القادرين على حماية الأنظمة من التهديدات الحديثة في العالم الرقمي المتطور.
targetAudiences: هذا الكورس مخصص لكل من يرغب فى بناء أساس قوى فى الشبكات قبل الدخول فى مجال الأمن السيبرانى.
مناسب لطلاب وخريجى كليات الحاسبات وتكنولوجيا المعلومات اللى حابين يبدأوا طريقهم بشكل منظم وواضح.
موجَّه للمبتدئين اللى عايزين يفهموا الشبكات بشكل عملى باستخدام أدوات حقيقية زى Cisco Packet Tracer.
مفيد جدًا لأى شخص ناوى يشتغل كـ SOC Analyst أو Penetration Tester وعايز يعرف إزاى الشبكات بتشتغل فعليًا.
مناسب لفنيين الدعم الفنى (IT Support) أو الإداريين اللى عايزين يوسعوا معرفتهم التقنية.
وكمان لأى حد عنده شغف وفضول يفهم إزاى الإنترنت بيشتغل، وإزاى الأجهزة بتتواصل مع بعض داخل الشبكة.

courseDetails.title: Financial Services: Introduction to ETFs
courseDetails.shortDescription: An introduction to Exchange Traded Funds (ETF's). With simple, clear explanations, examples, constitution and more
courseDetails.longDescription:
Introduction to ETFs: A Beginner’s Guide


“Introduction to ETFs” will help you understand one of the simplest and most powerful investing tools available today — Exchange-Traded Funds (ETFs).


An ETF might sound complicated, but it’s simply a basket of investments — like stocks or bonds — that you can buy and sell just like a single share.


ETFs are used by everyday investors and professionals alike to grow wealth, reduce risk, and diversify portfolios.


In this course, you’ll learn exactly how they work, why they’re popular, and how they are used build an investment foundation.


You don’t need any background in finance. This course was designed for complete beginners — people who may have never bought a stock, opened a brokerage account, or heard terms like “index fund” or “diversification.”


We’ll cover what an ETF is, how it’s constituted and how it compares to other funds and individual stocks.


You’ll learn what “passive investing” really means, and be able to tell whether a fund fits your goals as an individual, business, professional or just an interested party.


By the end, you’ll understand the key principles behind long-term investing and risk management.

This is a practical, plain-language introduction to investing (ETFs in particular) — the same foundational knowledge used by financial planners, fund managers, and everyday investors who grow their wealth steadily and safely over time.


ETF's are used to meet diverse objectives: whether you want to save for retirement, invest a side income, or simply understand what’s happening in your investment account, this introductory course gives you the clarity and confidence to get started.


No jargon. No hype. Just real understanding — one lesson at a time.


Join today and take the first step toward becoming an informed investor. By the time you finish, you’ll not only understand how ETFs work — you’ll know how to use them to start building lasting financial security.


Areas covered by this course include:


  • Understand what an ETF (Exchange-Traded Fund) is in plain terms

  • Describe how buying one ETF can give exposure to many companies

  • Identify what diversification means and why it matters

  • Explain what happens when you buy or sell an ETF

  • Understand what an index is (like S&P 500, FTSE 100)

  • Learn how ETFs can fit into your long-term goals

  • Recognize the difference between active and passive investing

  • Understand how ETFs are traded just like stocks

  • Learn simple steps to start building a diversified portfolio

  • Build confidence comparing different types of funds

  • Learn how to check if an ETF aligns with your goals

  • Feel prepared to start your own investing journey safely


Thank yo for stopping by and look forward to engaging with you.


Best regards,

Baba Oyewole FCCA
